comment: As long as you stay on top of the homework, listen to the lectures, and read the textbook, you'll be fine in his class. Not a bad professor at all, he just doesn't hand out easy grades like some people like; you actually have to work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: I think people were too hard on him. He is a good enough. His exams are difficult but he gives plenty of opportunity to improve your grade in the class. He was always willing to answer questions. You just need to make sure you go to class and pay attention. People say that nothing he says is on the test.... LIES EVERYTHING HE SAYS IS ON THE TEST!!!

His micro class is hard, but doable. *Definitely* read the textbook and go to class. If you have a question, his answers are straight info, but not passive aggressive. Attendance is random. Tests are heavy and *very* detailed. Some extra credit. Sometimes gives topics to go over as a study guide. HW is easy but takes a while. OverallgoodProfessor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Although he is knowledgeable, he gives a very monotone lecture with little to no class interaction on a daily basis. No study guides or ppt lectures given, mainly textbook and personal notes. Overall, could be a better class to push student success.
He teaches like we are grad students and as if we already know the material. He does not post his lectures so you'll be teach yourself. Good luck!

Whenever I asked him what I should study, he always said "what I went over in lecture", but he does not post lecture slides. The book is very dense, so studying for his exams is challenging, and they are weighted heavily. I really (really!!) just needed help (we did not have an S.I) and I feel like he didn't realize how much we were struggling.

Guys, please don't take this professor. Ask questions because he will be passive-aggressive if you miss something and will not be understanding if your misunderstanding was his fault. He also does not speak loudly or seem very prepared for lectures so be ready to learn from the book mostly.

Avoid at all costs. His power points are absolute bare bones and he does not add anything to them at all. You are better off teaching yourself. He is SO passive aggressive, so don't expect him to answer emails with anything but attitude. If you have to take him, read the text book, take very detailed notes and you should be fine.

Really don't understand this guy. You can tell he's passionate about Microbiology but he teaches as if you should already know everything. Reads from the slide most of the time so expect to teach yourself. Exams are nothing you learned and forget about getting a response from this guy. Homework and quizzes will be the only thing that helps you.

Get ready to teach yourself. His lectures are useless and there is no point attending because he only reads off the PowerPoint. I had to take notes from the textbook to learn the material. He does not prepare his students at all for the exams and can be quite passive-aggressive.

I would not recommend this class to anyone. 
I have never seen such lack of respect and care for students in my life. He is there to simply collect his money and thats it. He does less than bare minimum and leaves his students unprepared for the exams and never can answer a question. He will blame it on anyone else and is very passive aggressive!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Get ready to teach yourself. His lectures are painfully boring. His power points include the main topics from the textbook and the only study material he provides is learning outcomes. He responds to emails with short and very passive aggressive responses just as he responded to the other reviews posted on here. Avoid taking him if you can.

Attendance was taken but it was random, and the lectures were useless because they were just read to us. Gives "verbal" study guides that are useless because what he claims is super important is never on the exam. Gives extra credit at the end but it extremely critical when grading it. Pay attention to grade,he messed up grades by letter difference

He was a fine microbiology lab instructor, but the worst part of this class was his RANDOM assignments that were not scheduled or made known that he posted them and they are a HUGE part of your grade. So unless you have the drive to make sure you check his class assignments EVERYDAY, then you'll be fine. Me personally, no thank you. not worth it.

Dr. Gabriel is a decent professor. I had him for lab and he was OK. Some of his instructions were not very clear but, he was always willing to clarify further if asked. He was always accessible outside of class and responded to emails in a timely manner. Overall if you need a good lab professor, he is the one for you.
